condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.2. By 2021, the Government and partners have strengthened capacity for delivery and monitoring of equitable, quality nutrition therapeutic services at district and community levels.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported capacity building of 445 health workers and 2,575 volunteers in the 14 districts, procurement of 25,668 cartons of RUTF including 142 and 95 boxes F-75 and F-100 respectively, for the 58 targeted drought affected distrcits. A total of 3,136 children aged 6 to 59 months with severe acute malnutrition were treated with a cure rate of 70%. A total of 1,745 children with moderate acute malnutrition were also admitted and treated. A coordination mechanism for the drought response was established.A major challenge is RUTF stockouts in non-drought affected districts as government continues to have limited fiscal space. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Number of caregivers of children less than 2 years old who are reached messages on breastfeeding, young child feeding or healthy diets in the context of COVID through national communication campaigns [COVIDSitRep]
Percentage of health facilities that provide treatment services for the management of SAM
The national MIS produces quaterly reports / dashboards on performance against key indicators for all districts within a month
